title: Authors and Citation
text: Eric Finnesgard. Author, maintainer. Jennifer Grauberger. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Finnesgard E, Grauberger J (2023). utile.tables: Build Tables Publication. R package version 0.3.0, https://github.com/efinite/utile.tables.
code: @Manual{,   title = {utile.tables: Build Tables for Publication},   author = {Eric Finnesgard and Jennifer Grauberger},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.3.0},   url = {https://github.com/efinite/utile.tables}, }

title: Build Tables for Publication
text: Methods building customized, ready--export tables publication purposes.

title: Build Tables for Publication
text: build_table(): Generate summary table data object, data.frame. build_row(): Summarize factor, logical, numeric vector. build_model(): Build summarize varying models based model object.

title: Build Cox PH models — build_model.coxph
text: Models specified terms model data existing model returns clean, human readable table summarizing effects statistics newly generated model. functions greatly simplifies fitting large number variables set time--event data.

title: Build Cox PH models — build_model.coxph
code: # S3 method for coxph build_model(   .object,   ...,   .mv = FALSE,   .test = c("LRT", "Wald"),   .col.test = FALSE,   .level = 0.95,   .stat.pct.sign = TRUE,   .digits = 1,   .p.digits = 4 )

title: Build Cox PH models — build_model.coxph
text: .object object class coxph. ... One unquoted expressions separated commas representing columns model data.frame. May specified using tidyselect helpers. .mv logical. Fit terms single multivariable model. left FALSE, terms fit univariate models. .test character. name stats::drop1 test use model. .col.test logical. Append columns test accompanying statistic used derive p-value. .level double. confidence level required. .stat.pct.sign logical. Paste percent symbol reported frequencies. .digits integer. number digits round numbers . .p.digits integer. number p-value digits report. Note p-value still rounded number digits specified .digits.

title: Build Cox PH models — build_model.coxph
text: object class data.frame summarizing provided object. tibble package installed, tibble returned.

title: Build Cox PH models — build_model.coxph
code: library(survival) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  data_lung <- lung |>   mutate_at(vars(inst, status, sex), as.factor) |>   mutate(status = case_when(status == 1 ~ 0, status == 2 ~ 1))  fit <- coxph(Surv(time, status) ~ 1, data = data_lung)  # Create a univariate model for each variable fit |> build_model(sex, age) #> Error in eval(.object$call$data): object 'data_lung' not found

title: Build models — build_model
text: Models specified terms model data existing model returns clean, human readable table summarizing effects statistics newly generated model. function meant simplify fitting large number variables set time--event data.

title: Build models — build_model
code: build_model(.object, ...)

title: Build models — build_model
text: .object object supported class. See S3 methods . ... Arguments passed appropriate S3 method.

title: Build models — build_model
text: object class tbl_df (tibble) summarizing provided object.

what: Summarize a data.frame or tibble — build_row.data.frame
title: Summarize a data.frame or tibble — build_row.data.frame
text: Summarize data.frame (row counts). Optional stratification using factor logical size tibble.

title: Summarize a data.frame or tibble — build_row.data.frame
code: # S3 method for data.frame build_row(   x,   y = NA_real_,   label = "n(%)",   stat.pct.sign = FALSE,   col.overall = TRUE,   col.missing = FALSE,   col.test = FALSE,   digits = 1,   ... )

title: Summarize a data.frame or tibble — build_row.data.frame
text: x data.frame object. Data summarize. Must length y (specified). y factor logical. Data stratify x . label character. name summarized variable. stat.pct.sign logical. Paste percentage symbol frequency. frequency. col.overall logical. Append column statistic data. y specified, parameter ignored. col.missing logical. Append column counts missing data. col.test logical. Append column name statistical test used. digits integer. Number digits round . ... Additional arguments passed S3 method.

title: Summarize a data.frame or tibble — build_row.data.frame
text: object class tbl_df (tibble) summarizing provided data.

title: Summarize a data.frame or tibble — build_row.data.frame
code: # Create a "count" row from a data.frame for a factor build_row(x = datasets::mtcars, y = as.factor(datasets::mtcars$cyl)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   Variable Overall `4`       `6`      `8`       p     #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>     <chr> #> 1 n(%)     32      11 (34.4) 7 (21.9) 14 (43.8) ""

title: Summarize factor data — build_row.factor
text: Summarize factor data tibble. Optional stratification null hypothesis testing using another factor logical.

title: Summarize factor data — build_row.factor
code: # S3 method for factor build_row(   x,   y = NA_real_,   label = "< variable >",   label.stat = TRUE,   stat.pct.sign = FALSE,   col.overall = TRUE,   col.missing = FALSE,   test = c("chisq", "fisher"),   test.simulate.p = FALSE,   col.test = FALSE,   digits = 1,   p.digits = 4,   ... )

title: Summarize factor data — build_row.factor
text: x factor. Data summarize. Must length y (specified). y factor logical. Data stratify x . label character. name summarized variable. label.stat logical. Append summary statistic used label summarized row. stat.pct.sign logical. Paste percentage symbol frequency. col.overall logical. Append column statistic data. y specified, parameter ignored. col.missing logical. Append column counts missing data. test character. Name statistical test compare groups. Supported options include Pearson's Chi-squared Test ('chisq') Fisher's Exact Test ('fisher'). test.simulate.p logical. Whether use Monte Carlo simulation p-value testing nominal data. col.test logical. Append column name statistical test used. digits integer. Number digits round . p.digits integer. Number p-value digits report. ... Additional arguments passed S3 method.

title: Summarize factor data — build_row.factor
text: object class tbl_df (tibble) summarizing provided data.

title: Build summary rows — build_row
text: Summarize data data.frame row(s). Includes optional stratification null hypothesis testing using factor logical variable.

title: Build summary rows — build_row
code: build_row(x, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame build_row(   x,   y = NA_real_,   label = "n(%)",   stat.pct.sign = FALSE,   col.overall = TRUE,   col.missing = FALSE,   col.test = FALSE,   digits = 1,   ... )  # S3 method for numeric build_row(   x,   y = NA_real_,   label = "< variable >",   label.stat = TRUE,   stat = c("mean", "median"),   stat.pct.sign = FALSE,   col.overall = TRUE,   col.missing = FALSE,   test = c("anova", "kruskal", "wilcoxon"),   col.test = FALSE,   digits = 1,   p.digits = 4,   ... )  # S3 method for logical build_row(   x,   y = NA_real_,   label = "< variable >",   label.stat = TRUE,   inverse = FALSE,   stat.pct.sign = FALSE,   col.overall = TRUE,   col.missing = FALSE,   test = c("chisq", "fisher"),   test.simulate.p = FALSE,   col.test = FALSE,   digits = 1,   p.digits = 4,   ... )  # S3 method for factor build_row(   x,   y = NA_real_,   label = "< variable >",   label.stat = TRUE,   stat.pct.sign = FALSE,   col.overall = TRUE,   col.missing = FALSE,   test = c("chisq", "fisher"),   test.simulate.p = FALSE,   col.test = FALSE,   digits = 1,   p.digits = 4,   ... )

title: Build summary rows — build_row
text: x object supported class. See available S3 methods . data summaries. ... Arguments passed appropriate S3 method. y factor logical. Data optionally stratify x . label character. name summarized variable. stat.pct.sign logical. Paste percentage symbol frequency. frequency. col.overall logical. Append column statistic data. y specified, parameter ignored. col.missing logical. Append column counts missing data. col.test logical. Append column name statistical test used. digits integer. Number digits round . label.stat logical. Append summary statistic used label summarized row. stat character. Name summary statistic use. Supported options include mean ('mean') median ('median') continuous data. test character. Name statistical test compare groups. Supported options: [continuous data] ANOVA linear model ('anova'), Kruskal-Wallis ('kruskal'), Wilcoxon rank sum ('wilcoxon') tests; [nominal data] Pearson's Chi-squared Test ('chisq') Fisher's Exact Test ('fisher'). p.digits integer. Number p-value digits report. inverse logical. logical data, report frequencies FALSE values instead. test.simulate.p logical. Whether use Monte Carlo simulation p-value testing nominal data.

title: Build summary rows — build_row
text: object class tbl_df (tibble) summarizing provided data.

title: Build summary rows — build_row
code: strata <- as.factor(datasets::mtcars$cyl)  # Create a "count" row from a data.frame for a factor build_row(x = datasets::mtcars, y = strata) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   Variable Overall `4`       `6`      `8`       p     #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>     <chr> #> 1 n(%)     32      11 (34.4) 7 (21.9) 14 (43.8) ""     # Create a row summarizing a numeric by a factor build_row(x = as.numeric(datasets::mtcars$mpg), y = strata) # numeric #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   Variable              Overall `4`       `6`       `8`       p       #>   <chr>                 <chr>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>     <chr>   #> 1 < variable >, mean±SD 20.1 ±6 26.7 ±4.5 19.7 ±1.5 15.1 ±2.6 <0.0001  # Create a row summarizing a logical by a factor build_row(x = as.logical(datasets::mtcars$vs), y = strata) # logical #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   Variable           Overall   `4`       `6`      `8`   p       #>   <chr>              <chr>     <chr>     <chr>    <chr> <chr>   #> 1 < variable >, n(%) 14 (43.8) 10 (90.9) 4 (57.1) 0 (0) <0.0001  # Create a row summarizing a factor by a factor build_row(x = as.factor(datasets::mtcars$carb), y = strata) # factor #> # A tibble: 7 × 6 #>   Variable             Overall     `4`        `6`        `8`        p        #>   <chr>                <chr>       <chr>      <chr>      <chr>      <chr>    #> 1 "< variable >, n(%)" ""          ""         ""         ""         "0.0066" #> 2 "  1"                "7 (21.9)"  "5 (45.5)" "2 (28.6)" "0 (0)"    ""       #> 3 "  2"                "10 (31.2)" "6 (54.5)" "0 (0)"    "4 (28.6)" ""       #> 4 "  3"                "3 (9.4)"   "0 (0)"    "0 (0)"    "3 (21.4)" ""       #> 5 "  4"                "10 (31.2)" "0 (0)"    "4 (57.1)" "6 (42.9)" ""       #> 6 "  6"                "1 (3.1)"   "0 (0)"    "1 (14.3)" "0 (0)"    ""       #> 7 "  8"                "1 (3.1)"   "0 (0)"    "0 (0)"    "1 (7.1)"  ""

what: Build summary tables from coxph model objects — build_table.coxph
title: Build summary tables from coxph model objects — build_table.coxph
text: Takes Cox PH model object summarizes ready export, human-readable summary table.

title: Build summary tables from coxph model objects — build_table.coxph
code: # S3 method for coxph build_table(   .object,   ...,   .test = c("LRT", "Wald"),   .col.test = FALSE,   .level = 0.95,   .stat.pct.sign = TRUE,   .digits = 1,   .p.digits = 4 )

title: Build summary tables from coxph model objects — build_table.coxph
text: .object object class coxph. ... One unquoted expressions separated commas representing columns data.frame. May specified using tidyselect helpers. left empty, terms summarized. .test character. name stats::drop1 test use model. Supported tests include Wald's Test ('Wald') Likelihood Ratio Test ('LRT'). .col.test logical. Append columns test accompanying statistic used derive p-value. .level double. confidence level required. .stat.pct.sign logical. Paste percent symbol reported frequencies. .digits integer. number digits round numbers . .p.digits integer. number p-value digits report. Note p-value still rounded number digits specified .digits.

title: Build summary tables from coxph model objects — build_table.coxph
text: object class tbl_df (tibble) summarizing provided object.

title: Build summary tables from coxph model objects — build_table.coxph
code: library(survival) library(dplyr)  data_lung <- lung |>   mutate_at(vars(inst, status, sex), as.factor) |>   mutate(status = case_when(status == 1 ~ 0, status == 2 ~ 1))  fit <- coxph(Surv(time, status) ~ sex + meal.cal, data = data_lung)  fit |> build_table(Sex = sex, Calories = meal.cal, .test = 'LRT') #> Error in eval(.object$call$data): object 'data_lung' not found

what: Build summary tables from data.frame objects — build_table.data.frame
title: Build summary tables from data.frame objects — build_table.data.frame
text: Takes data.frame object summarizes columns ready export, human-readable summary table. Capable stratifying data performing appropriate hypothesis testing.

title: Build summary tables from data.frame objects — build_table.data.frame
code: # S3 method for data.frame build_table(   .object,   ...,   .by,   .inverse = FALSE,   .label.stat = TRUE,   .stat = c("mean", "median"),   .stat.pct.sign = FALSE,   .col.overall = TRUE,   .col.missing = FALSE,   .test.continuous = c("anova", "kruskal", "wilcoxon"),   .test.nominal = c("chisq", "fisher"),   .test.simulate.p = FALSE,   .col.test = FALSE,   .digits = 1,   .p.digits = 4 )

title: Build summary tables from data.frame objects — build_table.data.frame
text: .object data.frame. ... One unquoted expressions separated commas representing columns data.frame. May specified using tidyselect helpers. left empty, columns summarized. .unquoted expression. data column stratify summary . .inverse logical. logical data, report frequency FALSE values instead TRUE. .label.stat logical. Append type summary statistic column label. .stat character. Name summary statistic use numeric data. Supported options include mean ('mean') median ('median'). .stat.pct.sign logical. Paste percent symbol reported frequencies. .col.overall logical. Append column statistic data. .specified, parameter ignored. .col.missing logical. Append column listing frequencies missing data row. .test.continuous character. character. Name statistical test compare groups. Supported options include ANOVA linear model ('anova'), Kruskal-Wallis ('kruskal'), Wilcoxon rank sum ('wilcoxon') tests. .test.nominal character. Name statistical test compare groups. Supported options include Pearson's Chi-squared Test ('chisq') Fisher's Exact Test ('fisher'). .test.simulate.p logical. Whether use Monte Carlo simulation p-value testing nominal data. .col.test logical. Append column containing test p-value derived . .digits integer. number digits round numbers . .p.digits integer. number p-value digits report.

title: Build summary tables from lm model objects — build_table.lm
text: .object object class lm. ... One unquoted expressions separated commas representing columns data.frame. May specified using tidyselect helpers. left empty, terms summarized. .test character. name stats::drop1 test use model. Supported options include F-Test ('F') Chi-squared Test ('Chisq'). .col.test logical. Append columns test accompanying statistic used derive p-value. .level double. confidence level required. .stat.pct.sign logical. Paste percent symbol reported frequencies. .digits integer. number digits round numbers . .p.digits integer. number p-value digits report. Note p-value still rounded number digits specified .digits.

title: Build summary tables from lm model objects — build_table.lm
text: object class tbl_df (tibble) summarizing provided object.

title: Build summary tables from lm model objects — build_table.lm
code: library(dplyr)  data_mtcars <- datasets::mtcars |>   mutate_at(vars('vs', 'am'), as.logical) |>   mutate_at(vars('gear', 'carb', 'cyl'), as.factor)  fit <- lm(mpg ~ vs + drat + cyl, data = data_mtcars)  fit |> build_table() #> # A tibble: 7 × 3 #>   Variable      `HR [CI]`         p        #>   <chr>         <chr>             <chr>    #> 1 "(Intercept)" "19.3 [4.1-34.6]" "0.0147" #> 2 "vs"          "0 [-4.3-4.3]"    "0.9962" #> 3 "drat"        "1.8 [-1.5-5.1]"  "0.2747" #> 4 "cyl"         ""                ""       #> 5 "   4"        "Reference"       ""       #> 6 "   6"        "-6 [-10.1--2]"   "0.0051" #> 7 "   8"        "-10 [-16.1--4]"  "0.0022"

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. tidyselect all_of, any_of, contains, ends_with, everything, last_col, matches, num_range, one_of, starts_with

title: utile.tables 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-20 Fixed CRAN LazyData error

title: utile.tables 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-06-14 Removed methods dependency, opting base R’s match.call(). Micro-optimizations performance build_row() build_table() functions. Fixed character casting issue build_table.coxph() cause p-value rounding fail p-value scientific notation. Fixed broken filter build_model() removing existing model terms list interest. Added re-exports tidyselect helpers.

title: utile.tables 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-01 Replaced build_event_table() & build_event_rows() build_model() S3 method coxph models uses tidyselect syntax. Plain formulas survfit objects longer supported. build_table() converted S3 method now uses tidyselect syntax far easier use. data.frame method now works 7.5x faster prior version. function new home methods utile.tools::tabulate_model(). build_row() replaced S3 method directly exposes previously internal functions working raw factor, logical, numeric data. Support utile.tools:: version 0.2.5 added.

title: utile.tables 0.1.8
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-02 Upgraded backend functions compatible utile.tools:: version 0.2.3

title: utile.tables 0.1.7
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-19 Added graceful handling NULL table data build_event_row(). Tables created build_event_ now return unified hazard ratio confidence interval column behavior consistent build_row()/build_table().

title: utile.tables 0.1.6
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-19 Fixed logic build_event_row_() return reference table parameter skipped.

title: utile.tables 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2019-07-01 Addressed tibble::.tibble() depreciation. Backend function changes: .row_coxph(): Rewrote work utile.tools::tabulate_model() version 0.2.0. Rewrote reduce redundancy improve efficiency. Removed redundant code calls utile.tools::paste_freq().

title: utile.tables 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2019-06-04 First public release
